column4: xorg is in /etc/X11 .. what do you mean by "mine".. your video card?
no xorg.conf file in /ect/X11
and my mine i mean: "Why the hell is it using so much memory?"
they must have completely removed it for 9.10.. you *can* create your own and put it in that location.. what card/driver are you using?
I'm using the driver that came with ubuntu and it's an ati chip

yea.. I was struggling with an ati card earlier on my son's computer.. it's a radeon 9600 (av350 or something), older and it also uses the stock driver since there is nothing listed in Hardware Drivers.. it's pretty slow.. never checked to see how much mem it was using but I'll bet a bunch.. my machine has an nvidia.. much easier to configure
the stock driver sucks
yep..
anything i can do about it?

you could try installing the ati binary blob.. but do a lot of reading on the correct method.. including researching if their driver is compatible with your card and xorg 7.1+  .. some cards aren't.. also you'll probably have to reinstall with each kernel upgrade
oh no
installing dkms sometimes helps with the kernel upgrades.
maybe it will get fixed in an update
one can only hope :)
ati's been like this for the last couple of releases
I never had any issues before 9.10
it has everything to do with ati and almost nothing to do with ubuntu
but isn't the driver OSS now?
yes.. but in their latest design they left out quite a number of cards
oh
things should improve..
